trans-unit.source: This dialog is normally used by the activities <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.IfElseBranchActivity"></xref>, <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.WhileActivity"></xref>, <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ConditionedActivityGroup"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.ReplicatorActivity"></xref> to edit declarative conditions.

However, if you want to use conditions outside of these activities (for example, edit a condition for use outside of a workflow completely), you can use this dialog to perform the editing of the condition.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.Design.RuleConditionDialog"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity"></xref> that this condition is executed against.
Typically it is the workflow, but it can be any valid activity.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.Design.RuleConditionDialog"></xref> class with the specified activity type, the type provider, and the expression.
The type of the object that this condition is executed against.
Normally it is the workflow, but can be any valid type.
An optional <xref href="System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Compiler.ITypeProvider"></xref> implementation that is used to determine what types are available in the condition.
If one is not specified, only types in the assembly specified by activityType and any assemblies it references is available.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Workflow.Activities.Rules.Design.RuleConditionDialog"></xref>.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Gets the <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> as modified by the dialog box user.
The <xref href="System.CodeDom.CodeExpression"></xref> as modified by the dialog box user.
